DT Article
TI Elevation of Pilisaprinus to full generic status with notes on the
   evolution of termitoxeny in the Saprininae (Coleoptera: Histeridae).
AU Lackner, Tomas (tomaslackner@me.com) 
SO Acta Entomologica Musei Nationalis Pragae
VL 53
IS 2
PS 623-632
PD 2013
PY 2013
LA English
U1 0
U2 1
AB Pilisaprinus Kanaar, 1996, a monospecific Afrotropical termitoxenous
   subgenus of the genus Saprinus Erichson, 1834 is recognized as a valid
   genus based on the results of recent phylogenetic analysis. Pilisaprinus
   is redefined using a combination of plesiomorphic and apomorphic
   morphological characters, and its type species, Saprinus (Pilisaprinus)
   verschureni Therond, 1959 is re-described, with male genitalia,
   mouthparts and sensory organs illustrated and complemented with SEM
   micrographs. Notes on the evolution of termitoxeny in the Saprininae
   subfamily are provided.
C1 Lackner, Tomas; Czech Univ Life Sci, Fac Forestry & Wood Sci, Kamycka
   1176, Prague, Suchdol, CZ-16521, Czech Republic, Czech Republic.
EM tomaslackner@me.com
SC Environmental Sciences &Ecology; Zoology; Evolutionary Biology
SN 0374-1036
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; Diagnosis; Description; Combination;
   Taxonomy; Taxonomic position; Status; Evolution; Associations
DE Isoptera [Nest and burrow fauna / Saprininae (Coleoptera) / Termitoxeny
   evolution]. 
   Saprininae [Evolution /  / Isopteran nest associates; termitoxeny] [Nest
   and burrow fauna / Isoptera (Isoptera) / ]. 
TN Arthropods; Beetles; Insects; Invertebrates
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Insecta, Coleoptera, Polyphaga, Hydrophiloidea,
   Histeridae
OR Isoptera (Insecta). 
   Pilisaprinus - Kanaar 1996 (Histeridae): [Emended diagnosis, P. 625;
   Raised from, Saprinus (Pilisaprinus), p. 624]. 
   Pilisaprinus verschureni - (Therond 1959) (Histeridae): [Redescription,
   P. 625; Comb nov, Transferred from Saprinus (Pilisaprinus), p. 625]. 
   Saprininae (Histeridae). 
   Saprinus (Pilisaprinus) - Kanaar 1996 (Histeridae): [Raised to,
   Pilisaprinus, p. 624]. 
   Saprinus (Pilisaprinus) verschureni - Therond 1959 (Histeridae):
   [Referred to, Pilisaprinus, p. 625].

DT Article
TI Aphodiinae (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae) of the Goa, Maharashtra and
   Rajasthan (India) with description of Aphodius (Gilletianus) rajawatorum
   sp nov.
AU Kral, David (kral@natur.cuni.cz) 
   Sipek, Petr
SO Acta Entomologica Musei Nationalis Pragae
VL 53
IS 2
PS 633-648
PD 2013
PY 2013
LA English
U1 1
U2 1
AB Altogether 29 species of aphodiine tribes Aphodiini (24 species) and
   Psammodiini (5 species) were recorded in the states of Goa, Maharashtra
   and Rajasthan (India) during a faunistic research in 2002-2005. Findings
   of Aphodius (Pharaphodius) calo Balthasar, 1971 and A. (P.) redargutus
   Balthasar, 1971 represent new country records for India. Species A.
   (Megatelus) contractus Klug, 1845 and Pararhyssemus coluber (Mayet,
   1887) are new for the whole Indo-Pakistani subcontinent. Aphodius
   (Gilletiamts) raj awatorum sp. nov. from Rajasthan is described and
   illustrated. The new species is close to A. (G.) fukiensis Balthasar,
   1952, A. (G.) segmentaroides A. Schmidt, 1909 and A. (G.) therondi
   Balthasar, 1963 exhibiting distinctly narrow, almost parallel-sided
   protibia.

   Republic, Czech Republic.

TI Bunbunius quadrihamis sp nov from Sichuan province, China (Coleoptera:
   Scarabaeidae: Melolonthinae).
AU Sehnal, Richard (richard.sehnal@seznam.cz) 
SO Acta Entomologica Musei Nationalis Pragae
VL 53
IS 2
PS 649-655
PD 2013
PY 2013
LA English
U1 0
U2 1
AB Bunbunius quadrihamis sp. nov. from Sichuan province in China is
   described, figured, and an updated key to species of Bunbunius Nomura,
   1970 is presented. Bunbunius quadrihamis sp. nov. is closely related to
   B. pseudoopacipennis Keith, 2008 and B. prunellus (Arrow, 1946), from
   which it differs mainly in the shape of external male genitalia. New
   records for the species Bunbunius sinensis Keith, 2005 (China: Gansu,
   Shaanxi) are given.
C1 Sehnal, Richard; Czech Univ Life Sci Prague, Fac Agrobiol Food & Nat
   Resources, Kamycka 129, Prague, CZ-16521, Czech Republic, Czech
   Republic.
EM richard.sehnal@seznam.cz
SC Zoology
SN 0374-1036
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Taxonomy; Key; Land zones;
   Palaearctic region; Eurasia; Asia; China
DE Bunbunius quadrihamis [Sichuan /  / New species]. 
   Bunbunius sinensis [Gansu /  / New record] [Shaanxi /  / ]. 
TN Arthropods; Beetles; Insects; Invertebrates
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Insecta, Coleoptera, Polyphaga, Scarabaeoidea,
   Scarabaeidae
OR Bunbunius - Nomura 1970 (Scarabaeidae): [Key to species, Males, p. 653].
   
   Bunbunius quadrihamis (Scarabaeidae): [Sp nov, Sichuan, P. 650]. 
   Bunbunius sinensis (Scarabaeidae): [New record].

PT J
AN ZOOR15005023798
DT Article
TI A study on the genus Agrilaxia of French Guiana (Coleoptera:
   Buprestidae: Anthaxiini).
AU Bily, Svatopluk (svatopluk_bily@nm.cz) 
   Brule, Stephane
SO Acta Entomologica Musei Nationalis Pragae
VL 53
IS 2
PS 657-686
PD 2013
PY 2013
LA English
U1 0
U2 1
AB The genus Agrilaxia Kerremans, 1903 of French Guiana is revised and 16
   species are recorded. Except for two species formerly described from
   this 'territory, two Brasilian species and 12 undescribed species are
   recorded. Ten of them are described, illustrated and compared with the
   most similar species: Agrilaxia (Agrilaxia) cacao sp. nov., A. (A.)
   Caudata sp. nov., A. (A.) convexifrons sp. nov., A. (A.) cordicollis sp.
   nov., A. (A.) elegans sp. nov., A. (A.) glabra sp. nov., A. (A.)
   guianensis sp. nov., A. (A.) prolonga sp. nov., A. (A.) purpureiventris
   sp. nov. and A. (A.) sulcifrons sp. nov. The history of the taxonomic
   status ofAgrilaxia is briefly discussed and the morphological characters
   of the genus are evaluated. Three formal species-groups are suggested
   and characterised: A. aeruginosa species-group, A. bivittata
   species-group and A. opima species-group.
C1 Bily, Svatopluk; Czech Univ Life Sci, Fac Forestry & Wood Sci, Kamycka
   1176, Prague, Suchdol, CZ-16521, Czech Republic, Czech Republic.
EM svatopluk_bily@nm.cz
SC Zoology
SN 0374-1036
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Diagnosis; Land zones; Neotropical
   region; South America
DE Agrilaxia [French Guiana /  / Faunal list; new record; systematics]. 
   Agrilaxia (Agrilaxia) cacao; Agrilaxia (Agrilaxia) caudata; Agrilaxia
   (Agrilaxia) convexifrons; Agrilaxia (Agrilaxia) cordicollis; Agrilaxia
   (Agrilaxia) elegans; Agrilaxia (Agrilaxia) glabra; Agrilaxia (Agrilaxia)
   guianensis; Agrilaxia (Agrilaxia) prolonga; Agrilaxia (Agrilaxia)
   purpureiventris; Agrilaxia (Agrilaxia) sulcifrons [French Guiana /  /
   New species]. 
   Agrilaxia (Agrilaxia) chrysifrons; Agrilaxia (Agrilaxia) tristis [French
   Guiana /  / New record]. 
TN Arthropods; Beetles; Insects; Invertebrates

   Buprestidae
OR Agrilaxia - Kerremans 1903 (Buprestidae): [New record]. 
   Agrilaxia (Agrilaxia) bahiana - (Cobos 1972) (Buprestidae): [Diagnostic
   characters, P. 667].

   Agrilaxia (Agrilaxia) claudei - (Cobos 1972) (Buprestidae): [Diagnostic

   Agrilaxia (Agrilaxia) convexifrons (Buprestidae): [Sp nov, French
   Guiana, P. 670]. 
   Agrilaxia (Agrilaxia) cordicollis (Buprestidae): [Sp nov, French Guiana,
   P. 672]. 
   Agrilaxia (Agrilaxia) elegans (Buprestidae): [Sp nov, French Guiana, P.
   673]. 
   Agrilaxia (Agrilaxia) glabra (Buprestidae): [Sp nov, French Guiana, P.
   675]. 
   Agrilaxia (Agrilaxia) guianensis (Buprestidae): [Sp nov, French Guiana,
   P. 677]. 
   Agrilaxia (Agrilaxia) opima - (Kerremans 1897) (Buprestidae):
   [Diagnostic characters, P. 671]. 
   Agrilaxia (Agrilaxia) prolonga (Buprestidae): [Sp nov, French Guiana, P.
   679]. 
   Agrilaxia (Agrilaxia) purpureiventris (Buprestidae): [Sp nov, French
   Guiana, P. 680].

   P. 682].

   Agrilaxia freyella - Bily 1995 (Buprestidae): [Diagnostic characters, P.
   671].

DT Article
TI Two new species of the genus Coraebus from China (Coleoptera:
   Buprestidae: Agrilinae: Coraebini).
AU Xu, Hongxia (vkuban@nm.cz) 
   Ge, Sinqin
   Kuban, Vitezslav
   Yang, Xingke
SO Acta Entomologica Musei Nationalis Pragae
VL 53
IS 2
PS 687-696
PD 2013
PY 2013
LA English
U1 0
U2 3
AB Two new species of the genus Coraebus Gory & Laporte de Castelnau, 1839
   (Coleoptera: Buprestidae: Agrilinae: Coraebini: Coraebina) are described
   from China: Coraebus businskyorum Xu & Kuban, sp. nov. from Hubei,
   Chongqing and Sichuan, and C. volkovitshi Xu & Kuban, sp. nov. from
   Guangxi and Yunnan. Both are illustrated in details and compared with
   morphologically similar species.
C1 Xu, Hongxia; Chinese Acad Sci, Inst Zool, 1 Beichen West Rd, Beijing,
   100101, China, China.
EM vkuban@nm.cz
SC Zoology
SN 0374-1036
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Diagnosis; Land zones; Palaearctic
   region; Eurasia; Asia; China
DE Coraebus businskyonun [Chongqing /  / New species] [Hubei /  / ]
   [Sichuan /  / ]. 
   Coraebus volkovitshi [Guangxi Zhuang /  / New species] [Yunnan /  / ]. 
TN Arthropods; Beetles; Insects; Invertebrates
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Insecta, Coleoptera, Polyphaga, Buprestoidea,
   Buprestidae
OR Coraebus amplithorax - (Fairmaire 1889) (Buprestidae): [Diagnostic
   characters, P. 691]. 
   Coraebus businskyonun - Xu & Kuban 2013 (Buprestidae): [Sp nov, Hubei,
   P. 688]. 
   Coraebus linnei - Obenberger 1922 (Buprestidae): [Diagnostic characters,
   P. 695]. 
   Coraebus volkovitshi - Xu & Kuban 2013 (Buprestidae): [Sp nov, Yunnan,
   P. 692].

DT Article
TI Two new species and one new combination of Stenosini (Coleoptera:
   Tenebrionidae) from Xizang, China.
AU Ba, Yi-Bin (ybba@hbu.edu.cn) 
   Ren, Guo-Dong
SO Acta Entomologica Musei Nationalis Pragae
VL 53
IS 2
PS 697-702
PD 2013
PY 2013
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB Two new species of the tribe Stenosini (Coleoptera: Tenebrionidae),
   Tetranillus nyingchiensis sp. nov. and Pseudethas (Stenillus)
   cordiformis sp. nov., are described. One species, Indochillus
   convexigena Ren & Shi, 2006, is transferred to the genus Pseudethas
   Fairmaire, 1896 as Pseudethas convexigenus (Ren & Shi, 2006), comb. nov.
C1 Ba, Yi-Bin; Museum Hebei Univ, Baoding, Hebei, China, China.
EM ybba@hbu.edu.cn
SC Zoology
SN 0374-1036
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Combination; Taxonomy; Taxonomic
   position; Land zones; Palaearctic region; Eurasia; Asia; China
DE Pseudethas (Stenillus) cordiformis; Tetranillus nyingchiensis [Xizang / 
   / New species]. 
   Stenosini [Xizang /  / Distribution; systematics]. 
TN Arthropods; Beetles; Insects; Invertebrates
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Insecta, Coleoptera, Polyphaga, Tenebrionoidea,
   Tenebrionidae
OR Indochillus convexigena - Ren & Shi 2006 (Tenebrionidae): [Referred to,
   Pseudethas (Pseudethas), p. 701]. 
   Pseudethas (Pseudethas) convexigenus - (Ren & Shi 2006) (Tenebrionidae):
   [Comb nov, Transferred from Indochillus, p. 701]. 
   Pseudethas (Stenillus) cordiformis (Tenebrionidae): [Sp nov, Xizang, P.
   699]. 
   Stenosini - Lacordaire 1859 (Tenebrionidae). 
   Tetranillus nyingchiensis (Tenebrionidae): [Sp nov, Xizang, P. 698].

PT J
AN ZOOR15005023801
DT Article
TI A new genus and species of the Afrotropical Platynotina from Tanzania
   (Coleoptera: Tenebrionidae: Pedinini).
AU Kaminski, Marcin Jan (mkaminski@miiz.waw.pl) 
SO Acta Entomologica Musei Nationalis Pragae
VL 53
IS 2
PS 703-714
PD 2013
PY 2013
LA English
U1 0
U2 8
AB Paraselinus iwani, a new genus and species of the subtribe Platynotina
   (Tenebrionidae: Tenebrioninae: Pedinini) is described from the East
   African mangroves of Tanzania. The prothoracic skeletal structure of
   this new taxon is illustrated using X-ray microtomography (microCT). Due
   to the total wing loss, transverse antennomeres 7-11 and specific
   prothoracic structure (lack of basal depressions on pronotal disc)
   Paraselinus gen. nov. is similar to Aberlencus Iwan, 2002, Angolositus
   Koch, 1955, Lechius Iwan, 1995, Pseudoselinus Iwan, 2002 and Upembarus
   Koch, 1956. A brief discussion on the generic relationships within the
   Central African Platynotina is included. An identification key to the
   Paraselinus gen. nov. and related genera is provided.
C1 Kaminski, Marcin Jan; Polish Acad Sci, Museum & Inst Zool, Wilcza 64,
   Warsaw, PL-00679, Poland, Poland.
EM mkaminski@miiz.waw.pl
SC Zoology
SN 0374-1036
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Land zones; Afrotropical region;
   Africa
DE Paraselinus iwani [Tanzania /  / New species]. 
TN Arthropods; Beetles; Insects; Invertebrates
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Insecta, Coleoptera, Polyphaga, Tenebrionoidea,
   Tenebrionidae
OR Paraselinus (Tenebrionidae): [Gen nov, Of subtribe Platynotina, Type
   species Paraselinus iwani, p. 705]. 
   Paraselinus iwani (Tenebrionidae): [Sp nov, Tanzania, P. 707]. 
UT ZOOREC:ZOOR15005023801
